review: Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I wanted to share my story also for people who are considering trying this out. I had big fibroids and was scheduled for a laproscopic hysterectomy. My doc put me on Lupron for 4 months before the hysterectomy. She felt it would help me in hopefully shrinking my fibroids down to help with surgery. She wanted me to take the 3 month dose. I am very scared of side effects and really don't like taking anything. I did my research and decided I only felt comfortable taking the once a month lower dose Lupron shot. I was afraid to even try that. I was on Lupron for 4 months and I did bleed for the first month on it and then my bleeding and periods stopped after the first month. My only side effect was HOT FLASHES! But as time went by they seemed to get a little better and they calmed down some. It wasn't too bad, but definitely uncomfortable at times. Thats all though! So happy that I moved past my fear and tried it. It helped stop my periods and I was able to get the laproscopic hysterectomy done.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):Lupron did not work for me. I took this medication as a last resort prior to having surgery to try and stop further growth of my already large fibroids and stop the hemorrhage level bleeding that I was regularly experiencing. This was a injection taken once every 3 months. While taking, my bleeding continued to get heavier. I had all the side effects and none of the stated good effects. The doctors don’t tell you that this medication may not work and when I told my doctor that it’s not effective and I continued to have heavy bleeding she still wanted me to continue taking this very expensive medication. For me it wasn’t worth it. The mood swings alone made me feel awful, I had memory fog, and the hot flashes were so intense. Take with extreme caution.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I have not had the injection yet but am taking the one month version today.  I am nervous after reading these things.  I have over 20 fibroids. One that is 10 cm, I can feel touching my rib cage.... YES, my rib cage.  This will be my second fibroid surgery but this one is worse.  Has anyone had a provider say to use progestin (low dose) to help minimize the side effects?  I was told you should not use estrogen based BC with these products.  Will I need calcium/vit D for my bone health?  I am worried about hair loss.  The Anemia I have has already made my hair fall out.  I don't need any more help with that.   Please share your experiences.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):The Lupron injection was a lifesaver.  In November 2019, I was 50 years old and I had been bleeding for 75 days, due to uterine fibroids. My hemoglobin was down to 5.1 and I had to have blood transfusions in the hospital. So far so good, no bleeding at all, until today, when I started bleeding again the first time, since November 2019. I'm now almost 53 years old and I'm scared to death, I have to go to the doctor on Thursday. Has anyone else had their periods restart after so much time, not having them following the Lupron injection? I know the injections wear off I'm not sure if they will administer more to stop the bleeding now ?

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I took luprodex 3.75mg injection for 5 months on monthly basis to reduce the severe cramp.and pain associated with monthly flow. First month of injection was still painful but the subsequent months were normal and I also ovulated well on month 4. Then after the last dose, it took just 6 weeks before my period returned. It was quite normal but with a very light right abdominal cramp. I will do scan to check if the bulky uterus has reduced because I want to conceive too. One important observation is that it did not stop my period for those months . I usually see my period each month but did not see the next month when I stopped the injection. It was a beautiful experience though I had severe leg cramp/ arthritis...

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):This ruined my life! I don't recommend it. Get a surgery, and if you get pregnant, get a C-section. This drug (6 injections) was recommended by my doctor. The only choice he gave me and he didn't tell me the lifetime side effects.  There was just the 6 months suspension of periods, (sweats, moods). In 2005 I was 32 years old, recently married, and we wanted to have children. Now, I'm 47 yrs old, we didn't have children anyway and I don't lubricate, it hurts when have sex, and my libido its gone, all this for the last 15 years, and I think for the rest of my life.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I developed several fibroids in my late 40s that caused very heavy bleeding. I opted for a hysterectomy and was given one shot of Lupron about 3 months prior in the hope that it would shrink the fibroids before I had surgery. I cannot say that it shrunk them (my uterus size was comparable to a 5-month pregnancy), but it did stop my periods immediately and that it made it worth it to me. The only side effect I ever experienced were extremely painful cramps a few times (once so bad I had to pull off the road because I was driving). Still worth it.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):My experienced with Lupron Depot has been challenging, I have side effects of memory loss, trouble breathing (did not have this before), heart palpitations just about everyday (worst at night) nausea, extreme tiredness (daily), periods had stopped before but started up when taking Lupron Depot (very light to spotting). I am in my second month of the 3 month injection and  I now have body aches, hot flashes every 15 minutes all day, as subsided to every 30 min to an hour as getting close to wearing off.  I will not know if the fibroid has shrunk until after the 3 months have passed. Not interested in sex, so not want to be touched. Very sensitive since shot and not having a taste for really anything. Feet swollen like Ms. Piggy.  Would I get again...heck NO!  I would stop eating Red Meat First and drink healthy smoothie with raw veggies and fruit first.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):This is user Jennybean from the review below (August 12, 2020).  I could not log in with that username so here's my update:  I got my first injection on 08/14/20.  Ultimately I am getting the 3 month 11.25MG Kit.  So I assume I will get 2 more shots.  I got the shot in my butt cheek & did not hurt or flare up. The side effects for me so far: A couple short lived hot flashes here and there.  Fatigue & my boobs are sore (like before a period and wearing a bra sucks as a result).   These effects are medium-mild & are not overwhelming. I'd say the fatigue and breast tenderness are the most bothersome.  I expect I will be adding to my list of side effects as we go on. The last thing I'll add is that my biggest fibroid is 7cm and my uterus never shrunk after I had my preemie son at 28 weeks pregnant.  So basically, I STILL look six months pregnant 6 years later.  That's why I'm on this medicine.  I need to shrink my uterus and fibroid in order to have a less invasive partial hysterectomy (leaving my ovaries).

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I am getting my first  injection 11.25mg/3 month at the end of this week for Uterine Fibroids.  I am scared of flipping my body into fake, sudden menopause.  I need to shrink a fibroid in order to have a partial hysterectomy and this is the route I chose despite being wary.  I will come back to update.  So far, just getting the approvals to get this stuff has been quite challenging! I should be ending my 3rd month on Lupron but it took that long just to get it.  Good thing I didn't lose too much blood in the meantime on a period (which is what prompted me to seek this treatment in the first place). Again, I will come back and provide my experience once I get my shot this week.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I feel the obligation to share my experience as it might help someone looking for some answers. I was prescribed this Lupron Depo  shot prior to my second fibroid surgery with the intention to shrink a large fibroid, as the 1st surgery was unsuccessful at removing the whole thing. I was bleeding significantly due to the fibroid and the only benefit of having this shot was that it did stop my bleeding completely for 3 months. Other that, I cannot ethically say anything positive about this shot. I started to have these large, painful cysts on my face that have yet to subside. It’s been 6 months since I got a 3-month dose shot and my face is still covered in cysts. Ironically, this shot also made my fibroid grew bigger. It took an additional 2 attempts to remove the fibroid. The whole point of the shot was to shrink it so only 1 more attempt would be needed. Please do your research. This shot completely messed up my hormones.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I started the shot in June 2018 due to having multiple fibroids on my uterus. I was bleeding very bad for months non stop. I had the Nexplanon (BC) in and took that out to see If the bleeding would stop as well. I took the shot for 6 months and then the doctor removed my fibroids located outside uterus on November 29, 2018. The doctor stated that he could not remove two fibroids in my uterine cavity and that he would keep an eye on them. As time went on I was still bleeding bad and got back on the Lupron injection in August 2019. I had another surgery on November 7, 2019 and my fibroids located in the uterine cavity shrunk. I did not get the shot in November and had a cycle November 23, 2019. It was heavy at first but it stopped after 5 days. My fibroids have grown back since last year and are located on the outside of my uterus. The shot may help some and it may not.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I am 48 yrs old.    I was bleeding nonstop for over a year due to a large fibroid.....and I was in much pain.  In Jan 2019 I started my Lupron 3 month shot, and I’ve had two more shots since then (every three month). I have not bled since Jan.  My 6cm centrally located fibroid shrunk to 5cm within 6 months.  My uterus reduced in size from 10cm to 8cm.  I was anemic but my blood levels are back to normal now.  I do get hot flashes often.  My hair is thinning and  dry. My biggest problem is bone pain in my fingers /toes.  But that’s nothing compared to how bad I felt when I was bleeding.  I have been very moody at times over the past 10 months.  I’m supposed to schedule one more dose of the shot before my doctor will decide what to do next, hoping I can just start menopause so I don’t have to have surgery.  I also have multiple sclerosis.  But so far the MS flair up, due to this fibroid, is minimal.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had the Lupron shot on 1st July 2019 for fibroids. It was fine for the first 2 weeks. Just slight breast soreness and general signs like I was gonna get my period. After the first 2 weeks, I started getting hot flashes, fatigue and memory loss. Had a lot of problems recalling thoughts. I never bled since I had the shot which was weird. I thought I'd get one last major period or something. I had surgery to remove my fibroid in early September. The fibroid never shrank. Guess the jab didn't work on me. I'm still getting the hot flashes and the body aches as well as fatigue has gotten worse. I also gained weight! I found the drug increased my appetite. I still haven't gotten my period yet. Kind of happy about that but worried my hormones are all messed up. For reference, I'm 40 years old.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I got my first Lupron shot on 07/22/2019 for fibroids. My obgyn decided to put me on Lupron to attempt to shrink my fibroids/Uterus so I can have a safe hysterectomy. I haven't had a menstrual cycle since 07/22/2019 that's awesome. So far I am experiencing: first week my buttock was very sore/tender from the injection site. I am experiencing a lot hot flashes through out the day and at night they last a few minutes. No night sweats. My body, but mainly my legs ache and feel tingly/numb. Restless nights, having trouble staying asleep. My hair is now very dry and brittle and hair loss. (It was healthy before). Vaginal dryness. Memory problems, trouble focusing. I am forgetting a lot of things. Major mood swings, from very angry to crying. Increased appetite (carb craving). I hope all this is worth it at the end. None of these side effects are unbearable but I definitely do not feel myself. Round 2 coming up 10/22/2019.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I’ve been on Lupron depot for 4 months for heavy bleeding from a fibroid and extreme pain due to endometriosis. It has stopped my uterine and heavy bleeding and I have increased energy from not being anemic any longer. However, I have experienced hair loss, generalized whole body muscle pain and stiffness. As well as hot flashes, extreme jaw tension and teeth grinding at night and occasional insomnia.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I wanted to write a review for other women who are thinking about getting this injection. I read a lot of horror stories online so I was pretty nervous. I got the 3 month injection to try and shrink my large fibroids.Upshot is, it wasn't that bad but my fibroids didn't shrink; however, it stopped my periods. Preventing the excessive bleeding is good for health prior to hysterectomy. But it's expensive and insurance will make you jump through bureaucratic hoops to get it.After getting the shot, I felt kind of weird. Then I had one last awful period blowout a few days later. Since then, no periods.Menopause symptoms included hot flashes, brain fog, mild acne, some moodiness and irritability. However I think a lot of this can be worked around with good nutrition, exercise, breathable clothing, meditation.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I got the LUPRON 3 month shot in January. I’ve had so far now the hot flashes and some abdomen pain and depression and now these headaches I keep getting. The bleedings stopped which that’s the good part.  But the headaches gots to go. I don’t like to have to keep taking medication.  Those are my only issues.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I believe having this injection and educating yourself on the side effects goes hand in hand. I knew it could cause depletion of bones, I doubled up on calcium. I knew it would throw me into menopause, I immediately and consistently took black cohash. I had a hemoglobin of 6.5. It stopped my heavy periods which allowed it to rise to 12 in order to not have to have a transfusion during or after my hysterectomy. Educate yourself and prepare your body for the injection. The injection can not do all of the work, nor should you expect to.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had very heavy periods. My doctor offered lupron shot.  I decided to go with 2 lupron shots hopping it would shrink my fibroid.  Instead, my fibroid grew bigger.  It caused me horrible headaches with strongest pain killers not helping.  After each shot my period would not stop for a month (at least it was not heavy).  Hot flushes were horrible.  Good night sleep was gone.  I would wake up multiple times a night all drenched in sweat.  After effect of lupron wore out and my period re-started it was as heavy as before.  The only benefit I got was not having a period for few months (with some bleeding in between), but at a very high price (side effects and actual price).  I think as heavy as my period was it was better to have my period  for few days a month, than having frequent very bad headaches and constant hot flashes.   I would not recommend it based on my experience.  I would not have it done if I would have to decide today.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):This shot did not shrink my fibroids uterus before my operation. As a matter fact they grew.  It’s going on four months since I’ve had the shot, already had my operation.  Do still have my ovaries. I’m still getting hot flashes. I have a headache every day  of different levels. The nausea almost went away. Hot flashes are worse at night so I’m losing a lot of sleep.  The last three weeks my legs are aching every day when I get up. I have no desire to have sex.  This is definitely miserable. My doctor said the effects of the lupron would be gone in three months but they’re  still here. I don’t recommend the shot for anybody for any reason.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I am 28 with a 21cm x 13cm uterine fibroid. I was told me surgery would be risky and would leave me with a scar from under my chest to my pelvic area, since I am only 28 and would like to have children of my own they decided to put me on Lupron for 6 months to shrink the fibroid by hopefully 50% and have a much smaller and less risky surgery. Went on the shot in June, with the first month being the hardest, with headaches, night sweats, hot flashes and my first period being very heavy and lots of clots. But I am on my 2 shot month 2.5 months in and I can say most of those symptoms went away, I only get hot flashes which are definitely bearable.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had 8 tumors in my uterus and the doctors told me there was no way to remove them. They gave me 2 shots of lupron and I started losing my memory and the bleeding increased. I did a search for doctors that remove the tumors and I found one. He took out the tumors, I was able to keep my uterus and have had no problems since. I thank God everyday for this doctor! The only bad thing is thanks to the drug my memory is damaged for life.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):My experience was horrible. My Obgyn recommended lupron for my fibroids. I have 1 large one  the size of grapefruit, 3 the size of tennis balls and many pea size. Surgery not an option. I get lupron shots 1 time a month for 6 months. I had 13 acne cysts in total on my face that I had to have sugerically removed (over time). I gained 30 pounds almost overnight and it took me 3 years of intense dieting to get this weight off. My body thought I was going thru menopause so I had the hot flashes as well. I would not do it again. I spent a fortune only to find out after 6 months and all of this that the tumors were the same size. Years later I am having health issues and wondering if related to lupron usage.

I have been taking the Lupron shot for fibroids. I was bleeding so heavy I was wearing diapers could not wear pads anymore when I suffered my 6th stroke I told my doc look you are not putting me on any blood thinner suntil you fix the problem down there.  The first shot I bled afterward for like 3 days. But not as heavy as I normally would. My next shot is in July 2018. The first time I took the shot I had mood swings hot flashes at night headache and sleeplessness.  It takes you on a journey but my fibroids are shrinking tremendously. The newest side effect I discovered is swollen gums.  No fun. Do what you can to preserve your smile while taking this drug or you can lose your teeth.  I used to have a beautiful smile now that is gone.  The only drawback I have.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I am 52 (5'8", 155 lbs) w/ large (13 cm) intramural fibroid (fibroid w/in the muscle wall of the uterus).   In case I had any adverse reaction to Lupron, decided to take the low dose injection (1 x a month) instead of the single high dose that lasts three months.  Felt pretty okay w/ Lupron, other than a dull headache that lingered on for two months (I only had two injections).  The actual fibroid did not shrink much after two months (from 13 to 11 cm) but the surgeon said it made the fibroid softer.  Had a laparoscopic hysterectomy w/ success.  90% recovered after five days.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I have had like 8 fibroids super big  started 2015 March started bleeding blood clots. I was close to 50 years old so I found a study and she recommended lupron, I'm not gonna lie had 3 shots, my hair fell out - its gone, but for the pain I'm in right now might have to get my 4th shot.  This situation changes your life style 100%. Horrible uterus pain is unbelievable.  My hot flash/ cold flash worst are without lupron.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I was so skeptical about these shots, scared to death of the side effects after reading posts...I could kick myself! My shirts fall past my waist, I always looked pregnant. Slight headache, took generic aspirin, did the trick, hot flashes, weird but no that bad. Cycle, had one regular (heavy) period then skipped. Overall, I was so satisfied, I just called and ordered my second shot (I get them quarterly).Everyone reacts different to different types of medication...what works for others may not work for you but this did work for me.Good Luck...Sorry for the grammer stuff was in a rush

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I was diagnosed with a 13cm fibroid.  The doctor wanted to shrink it to be able to perform a lathroscopic hysterectomy.  I was having CONSTANT heavy bleeding for months on end, even the transamic acid wasn't slowing it down.   First drug we tried was Fibristal.  It was supposed to slow the bleeding and shrink the fibroid.  I took this for 6 months and it did ABSOLUTELY nothing.   The doctor then suggested Lupron Depot. The first week on Lupron was hard.  Bleeding was much heavier than before (which was already horrible).  But by week 2 the bleeding completely stopped.  By 5 months on Lupron my fibroid had shrunk to 11cm.  A bit of hot flashes. Some fogginess/irritability, but that's normal for me...lol

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had my heavy period and strong and constant pain which stops me doing my normal life for more than 5 years. Since I have started to inject this Lupron it has changed my life after all those painful years now I had 4 injections already and go for the fifth one. The only side effect I had is hot flashes especially during nights and some bone pain which are nothing to compare with the pain I had for more than 5 years. It is really worth to try if you are on the heavy bleeding and pain.

Lupron Depot-Gyn (leuprolide):I was on this medicine about a year ago but I only took it twice over 6 months(it was an every 3 months shot) I did not see any difference in the size of my waist. I didn't have professional test to show me a change in my size, I measured my waist each day. The measurement didn't change at all. Multiple doctors advised m that there would be no change if any due to the fact that I was very large. I recently had the Acessa procedure to help shrink the fibroids small enough to manage with a myomectomy surgery or hopefully without any other surgeries. At this point, it has been six weeks since the surgery and I am too afraid to measure myself yet. Will update in a couple months or so.
Lupron Depot (leuprolide):It cause me permanent hair loss.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):Had a large pedunctulated fibroid tumor on my uterus- shot was administered , they found my fibroid got larger after 3 months. Had to have a partial hysterectomy to have it removed so I could sit, drive and have sex without being uncomfortable or bleeding.  I had every side effect which was miserable. I had extreme hair loss (thinning) and I'm still trying to grow it back... this drug did not work for me. It has been over a year.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I was on lupron a few years ago. For chronic pain multiple cysts I was bed ridden a week or two of of every month. This injection saved my life back then. I lost coverage so i stopped. Now I have coverage and decided to try it again... its not working this time!. I'm in pain all the time still. I have trouble sleeping at night or staying asleep my libido is gone..and I'm in the 4th month of treatment and started bleeding and have really bad pains again.. and my got flashes are back. The first month is the worst! Worst period of my life.. but there was no bleeding until now.. so I would recommend trying the once a month doses first

Lupron (leuprolide):I am on a 3 month shot plan but monthly shots. I didn't want the 3 month all at once because I wanted to see how my body would react to it first.Shot given 12/07/16 and today is 12/28/16. The first week, I didnt really have any side effects and I was really hopeful that this will be the worse. Wishful thinking didnt last long. Hot flashes, night sweats, chills, emotional wreck and I believe slight headaches that come and go.BUT on the contrary, less than a month and my fibroid has already physically shrank. I havent seen the doc yet but I can physically see that it shrank. My clothes are loose in the belt line area. My fibroid was the size of a small grapefruit (17cm) but I really see a huge different in shrinkage.Could be worse :/

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):My rating is based SOLELY on symptoms, I am unsure about the effectiveness being that I haven't checked my fibroid size yet to see if it has suppressed. To furthermore explain, I was diagnosed with a large fibroid about 10cm (outside my uterus) through a CT scan. I'm 28, no children, but hoping to conceive in my early 30s, therefore I chose to go on with the Lupron shot (3.75) to hopefully shrink the fibroid for surgery early next year. After reading the side effects, I was terrified and put this off for a year and a half. I have had ONE symptom and that is I do notice that my  (face) is a bit clammy/dry. Just wishing I never put it off due to fear. I just finished my first month. Will update how month 2 went in January!
Lupron Depot (leuprolide):Finally, something that worked for my fibroids! Yay

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I have been on lupron for 3 years. I began the shot in 2013 with a 11 cm fibroid too large for surgery at time. I am now in my late 50's and still testing positive on hormon tests. another words if I go off lupron I a assuming the fibroid will grow again and I will begin again to menstruated and have heavy bleed and large clots.  my headaches became much less and only have hotflashes towards the end of my 3 month shot. I get shots quarterly. my bone density was just shy from normal with no concerns for many years. I take calcium, D3 and K2 (MK7-helps make calcium go to bone not soft tissue like calcification and bone spurs ).  for me is has been the best thing in my life.  I can't imagine why people have bad results. oh and no weight gain.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had a fibroid that had grown into my uterine cavity and it caused heavy bleeding, large blood clots, and discomfort.  I had surgery scheduled in June of 2016 and was given a Lupron injection in March of 2016 to shrink the fibroid to make surgery easier.  I had read terrible reviews and was scared of the side effects.  Overall my experience was very positive, I had minor side effects such as hot flashes and migraines.  I am in my mid-twenties and very active, which I believe helped.  No weight gain or hair loss.  I felt great throughout the 3 months and actually felt more mentally and hormonally balanced then ever before...I'm actually kind of upset it has worn off!  Don't be afraid of this drug, it worked wonders for me!
Lupron Depot (leuprolide):Lupron did not work on me. I still had heavy periods and serve cramps. My fibroids grew and did shrink. I was very angry that the shot didn't work

Lupron (leuprolide):I was given 7 monthly injections of Lupron, given to me at my PCP's office each month.  This was done for the fibroids I had and for the fact that I was on a plan to have an entire hysterectomy at the end of that 7 months. I bled very little really, but overall thats about the best thing I can say about that drugAfter every injection I was an emotional basketcase before I could even get back to my car from the doctors office--emotional to the hilt.   I'd go home and then...become lost in my own surroundings in my own home.  I would not recommend anyone who's planning on having a hysterectomy to use this 'pre-surgery' drug. Ever.  I mean, its hard enough to have to get a hysterectomy to begin with, then make it harder on yourself?

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):Received 3-month shot two weeks ago to stop heavy menstrual bleeding in preparation for a hysterectomy next month. My period started and the bleeding is just as extreme as usual. No relief in blood or pain with this drug. Have experience hot flashes (minor), headaches (minor), night sweats, nausea (moderate), and have pain in upper right back area. Will be seeing doctor later this week to get checked on. I know it's early in the process, but I'm disappointed. I took it knowing about the side effects, but was willing to go along with them to get my bleeding under control and to build up my iron stores.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):This drug was the worse form of treatment for my multiple symptoms - Daytime hot flashes and steady period was not worth it. I was administered this drug in 2008 and since then my life has never been the same. Forgetfulness covered in laughter by co-workers; poor cognitive skills, no sex drive & no desire to be touched. Headaches, blurred vision; quick weight gain and most of all I quit my job and I'm still try'n to figure out why when I was financially stable. Who was I?  Something in my brain is out of sync, I was not a person that took medicines. The Male-doctor pushed this on me & I was a patient with that organization for over 10yrs and I was the only 32yrs old & super active!

Lupron (leuprolide):Received a 3 month injection 8/20 for heavy bleeding due to fibroids.  Did not stop bleeding/spotting until middle of October.  Now I need another dose and the price jumped from $10 (promo fee) to $1,100- $3,000.  Needless to say I cannot afford the next round.  Also had a headache for full 3 months.  However, my doctor said it did shrink my fibroid enough to get the ablation I need.
Lupron Depot (leuprolide):This medicine has given me horrible headaches. Lost a lot of hair gained weight  insomnia.

Lupron Depot-Gyn (leuprolide):I started taking Lupron in November, 2014, and I am currently still taking the shots. I have had almost no side effects except for occasional hot flashes. I was put on Lupron because of heavy bleeding, due to my large fibroids. I am extremely happy with the results. My fibroids have shrunk to the point that I can now have a laparoscopic hysterectomy, rather than the old fashion full abdominal surgery. I haven't had a menstrual cycle in 9 months.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had the 3 month 11.25mg on 3/30/2015 to shrink my giant fibroid to the size that the laparoscopic myomectomy can be performed. I had no symptom of side effects for the first month and also having my period but ever since the second month (May) the side effects were really hitting me hard; including hot flashes and night sweat. Had my surgery at the end of June and my doctor confirmed that I had reacted to the Lupron more thanexpected as the fibroid not only shrink but part of it was degenerated. So Instead of a 2 hours operation, it ends up to be a 6 hours.  Now, it's been 5 months and the Lupron still lasting (period still not back yet), don't know when it will be gone...

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had extremely painful periods and constant bleeding. My doctor started me on the shot in Jan. and had second one in March. Best thing I ever did. No bleeding after 1st month and no pain after the 2nd month. Side effects were in my opinion mild. Worst were the hot flashes but in my opinion worth it. Doctor only wanted me to have to 2 shots so after June going to see what happens. I don't want to get on any birth control so will see what happens. I'm really hoping this makes it all better.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I've been on Lupron since March 2015. Just had my 2nd shot. I have to tell you it's taken 100% of my nagging back pain and cramps away. I even lost 12 pounds the first shot. It started to wear out towards the end so I took the shot 2 weeks early. I had surgery May 12th to remove a huge polyp and 2 fibroid tumors  - all benign. I'm having hot flashes and some headaches, some joint pain and that's about it. These symptoms are worth the trade from previous symptoms. I only hope my doctor gives me a hysterectomy soon. She feels Lupron will shrink the fibroids outside my uterus. I'm almost 50 so she says I should hold off on the hysterectomy. I want all this done with. Good luck to all of you.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):Awesome stuff!  I went on Lupron so I could be a candidate for focused ultrasound treatment.  Don't let all the negative reviews scare you!  I used to look about 4 months pregnant.  I am otherwise healthy, thin and exercise regularly.  Had minor hot flashes; not a big deal considering the overall benefits.  My mass of fibroids shrank dramatically in 3 months. Previously hard, round abdominal area shrank considerably!  I couldn't believe how successful Lupron was for me, and how good I felt on it.  I went off the pill (which I was on for years for constant bleeding/spotting).  Didn't have memory loss, hair loss or bad moods like many other women's experiences.  I took vitamins while on it to help counteract things like possible bone loss.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I must admit, after reading the commens I was real scared, but I told my self everyone's body reacts differently. May, 6/2014 I took my first shot so far I am feeling great. I was a bit drained before I took the shot, woke up feeling energetic.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):Received one shot for three full months. Nearing the end . Major side effects were the hot flashes and some weird feeling of uneasiness. I would not take it again. Hot flashes are not cool.  Just had ultrasound and will be seeing doctor soon to see if shot was a success in killing cysts. The drug may work but wow all these side effects.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I took this medication for 6 months due to extreme monthly bleeding caused by fibroids. I didn't have a period or spotting the entire 6 months or for 3 months after my last injection. I did not have even 1 side effect. It was a great experience. Hopefully I will have the same success with the Depo Shot!

Lupron Depot-Gyn (leuprolide):I was having very heavy periods due to fibroids. My Gyn gave me the shot and it was amazing! No more periods! the trade off I took was night sweats and early onset menopause, but after such heavy bleeding that I have very low blood count, anemia and vitamin D deffieciency, it was well worth it! I'm only in the last few weeks of my first shot, but I can't wait for the next one!

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had my first Lupron shot on August 10, 2012.  I started bleeding August 21, and it is now September 29 and have been bleeding ever since.  I've had a problem with anemia due to two fibroids.  I had my second Lupron shot on September 10.  I'm not sure I should continue this because I'm scared I won't be able to have surgery on November 2 due to anemia caused by blood loss.  Overall, Lupron is not working for me.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I had to get the 3 month Lupron Depot shot to help shrink my uterine fibroid and to help minimize the bleeding before surgery. After reading all the reviews on the shot I was very scared to get it but I am now going into my third month on the shot with minimal side effects. My doctor did recommend that I continue my birth control pills while on the shot to help add a little estrogen back into my system. I'm not sure if that's what help me with the side effects. All in all everyone's body reacts differently.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I was bleeding 24/7 and anemic due to a large fibroid.  First I tried Depo Provera shots, which didn't work.  All bleeding stopped about a week and a half after my first Lupron shot.  At this point, it's only been a month, so I don't know if I'll still need a hysterectomy.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I just received my 2nd shot of 3.75 Lupron and so far so good! I have heard horror stories not only on line, but from my friends who have been on it for various reasons and I was more than worried to start it. I have one large fibroid and I was put on Lupron injections to shrink it to make it easier for my husband and I to have a baby after I have a robotic myomectomy in June. I was so afraid of mood swings, but surprisingly, after 5 weeks I am still very happy. My bloating has gone away for the most part and I am really looking forward to not bleeding the way I did due to this fibroid! All in all, I am posting on here so that woman like myself, a 35 year old wanting a baby will know that not all Lupron horror stories will happen to you!

Lupron Depot-Gyn (leuprolide):This medicine has given me my life back. I no longer have to stay by a toilet due to extremely heavy periods that left me anemic. I no longer have pain during intercourse due to large fibroids and extremely painful periods. I was put on this medication to shrink fibroids for safer hysterectomy or until menopause kicked in. I am 49 and I have had no side effects since starting this medication.

Lupron (leuprolide):Side effects experienced from 3-month shot: hot flashes, night sweats, fatigue, cognitive "fuzziness", decreased memory. I experienced a significant temporary reduction in fibroid size/abdomen size (pre-surgery).

Lupron Depot-Gyn (leuprolide):Lupron Depot 11.25mg 3 month suspension has given me my life back. I have been on this for a month and saw my doctor today. His first words were wow! It is shrinking my huge fibroids. I had constant bleeding with flooding every month. Finally Sept 8th, 2010 I hemorrhaged. I was admitted into the hospital unconscious. Thank God my husband had the presence of mind not to sign a consent form for an emergency hysterectomy. I spot rarely now and have lost 4 pant sizes because the fibroids have shrunk so much. I will take my second shot on Jan 4th, 2011 and hope it will put me in permanent menopause. I am 49 and will avoid surgery at all costs. My side effects have been mild at best. My experience has been fantastic so far.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I can't say enough about how glad I am that I was given Lupron injections! I was being treated for heavy non-stop bleeding caused by the several large fibroids I had. I was told by 3 different Doctor's that I would definitely need to have a hysterectomy. I really had no other option. My OBGYN and the surgeon, started me on the Lupron injections 4 months ago to stop the bleeding (I had become extremely anemic and couldn't have the surgery until my blood counts came back up which would take 3 months) and to try and shrink the fibroids. After my 4th and final shot 2 weeks ago, my MRI showed that the fibroids had shrunk 75% and my surgeon discharged me today saying that I will NOT be having a hysterectomy, nor any surgery! Thank you Lupron.

Lupron Depot (leuprolide):I love that it completely stopped my outrageous heavy bleeding, which in turn made me anemic.  So I am happy for that.  However, the only side effect that I am experiencing is super dry skin on my arms, neck and face...I feel it is aging me overnight.  Some constipation, and not really hot flashes but warm spells every now and then.  Can't wait for surgery to get my hormones back to work.

Lupron Depot-Gyn (leuprolide):I didn't experience any major problems, except some mild stomach cramping initially and continued heavy bleeding for the first two injections. By my 3rd shot, just mild spotting and occasional cramping. I jut finished my 4th round, still no hot flashes, etc. I'm actually looking forward for my upcoming surgery soon.
Lupron Depot (leuprolide):Hot flashes throughout the day; moodiness and moderate depression and moderate fatigue.
